ticket.title: nested partials causing problem looking for correct file format
ticket.original-body: I have a .html.erb partial being rendered inside another .html.erb partial. This results in an error stating the partial is missing. It seems to be looking for the name of the partial (comment_reply), but in .json format. Other .html.erb partials are rendering fine in the same directory, and this one instance does as well if I spell out the extension like this: <%= render :partial => 'comment_reply.html.erb' %> instead of what I typically do like this: <%= render :partial => 'comment_reply' %>

I have a .html.erb partial being rendered inside another .html.erb partial. This results in an error stating the partial is missing. It seems to be looking for the name of the partial (comment_reply), but in .json format. Other .html.erb partials are rendering fine in the same directory, and this one instance does as well if I spell out the extension like this:
<%= render :partial => 'comment_reply.html.erb' %>
instead of what I typically do like this:
<%= render :partial => 'comment_reply' %>

version.title: nested partials causing problem looking for correct file format

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
